traits.name: Assassinate.
traits.desc: During their first turn, the Yiga has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the Yiga scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Cunning Action.
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the Yiga can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Evasion.
traits.desc: If the Yiga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Yiga instead takes no damage if it succeeds on a saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Teleport Attack.
traits.desc: Once per turn, the Yiga deals an extra 5 (1d6 + 2) damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Yiga that isn't incapacitated and the Yiga doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The Yiga makes two melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Windcleaver.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.desc: On each of its turns, the Yiga can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monsters.name: Large ChuChu
monsters.damage_resistances: acid
monsters.damage_immunities: damage type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one
monsters.senses: Darkvision 60 ft., Tremorsense 10 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Amorphous.
traits.desc: The chuchu can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Elemental Cloak.
traits.desc: The chuchu is visibly and magically cloaked with an energy matching the damage type to which it is immune, based on its color.

traits.name: Shocking Cloak.
traits.desc: The chuchu only has this trait if has an elemental cloak of lightning. Any creature which touches it directly or with an electricity-conducting weapon (including most metal weapons) takes 13 (4d6) lightning damage. If the creature takes this damage, it must also succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or drop everything it is holding and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d12 + 1) bludgeoning damage, plus an extra 12 (4d6) damage of type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature at least one size category smaller than the chuchu. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 14), and restrained for the duration of the grapple. While the target is grappled, at the beginning of each of the chuchu's turn the target takes 16 (4d8) acid damage plus an extra 10 (2d10) of a damage type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one. While the target is grappled, the chuchu cannot swallow another target.

actions.name: Withdraw.
actions.desc: The chuchu reduces itself to a formless puddle on the ground, and remains as such until the start of its next turn. While withdrawn, the chuchu is incapacitated; it has immunity to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage; and it has resistance to magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

reactions.name: Burst.
reactions.desc: The chuchu can only use this reaction if it has an elemental cloak. When reduced to 0 HP, a burst of magical energy gushes from the chuchu in all directions. Every creature within 15 feet of the chuchu must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 20 (4d10) damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage type matches that of the chuchu's elemental cloak.

monsters.name: Mage Yiga
spells: Mage Yiga is an 17th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). He regains his expended spell slots when he finishes a short or long rest. He knows the following warlock spells:

spells.At will: mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, disguise self, mage armor, invisibility

spells.1st–5th level (4 5th-level slots): augury, hold person, counterspell, fear, Raulothim's psychic lance, shadow of moil, scrying, synaptic static

spells.1/day each: eyebite, finger of death, maddening darkness, foresight

traits.name: Devil's Sight.
traits.desc: Mage Yiga can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
traits.desc: If Mage Yiga fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: Mage Yiga makes four eldritch blast attacks.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) force damage. When a creature is hit by this attack, Mage Yiga can move the target up to 10 feet toward or away from him.

actions.name: Temporal Strike (Recharge 6).
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 52 (8d12) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it’s occupied.

monsters.legendary_description: Mage Yiga can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Eldritch Blast.
legendary_actions.desc: Mage Yiga makes an eldritch blast attack.

legendary_actions.name: Escape.
legendary_actions.desc: Mage Yiga teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet.

legendary_actions.name: Create Hollow (Costs 3 Actions).
legendary_actions.desc: Mage Yiga casts the summon shadowspawn spell at 3rd level without expending a spell slot or material components.

monsters.name: Master Yiga
spells: (Innate) Master Yiga's spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Vanishing Step.
traits.desc: On Master Yiga's turn, in place of his normal movement, he can opt to teleport to a point he can see up 30 feet away. Once he uses this trait, the next attack against him before the start of their next turn has advantage.

traits.name: Evasion.
traits.desc: If Master Yiga is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack.
traits.desc: Once per turn, Master Yiga deals an extra 31 (9d6) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Master Yiga that isn't incapacitated and Master Yiga doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: Master Yiga makes four melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Demon Carver.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.legendary_description: Master Yiga can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack.
legendary_actions.desc: Master Yiga makes a weapon attack. This attack cannot benefit from his Sneak Attack feature.

legendary_actions.name: Vanishing Step.
legendary_actions.desc: Master Yiga uses his Vanishing Step trait.

legendary_actions.name: Barrier (Costs 2 Actions).
legendary_actions.desc: Master Yiga casts wall of force, using his Innate Spellcasting feature.

monsters.name: Mighty Yiga
spells: (Innate) Mighty Yiga's spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17). He can innately cast the disguise self spell at will, requiring no material components.

traits.name: Vanishing Step.
traits.desc: On Mighty Yiga's turn, in place of his normal movement, he can opt to teleport to a point he can see up 30 feet away. Once he uses this trait, the next attack against him before the start of their next turn has advantage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: Mighty Yiga makes three melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Windcleaver.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d10 + 8) slashing damage.

monsters.legendary_description: Mighty Yiga can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack.
legendary_actions.desc: Mighty Yiga makes one attack with his Windcleaver.

legendary_actions.name: Vanishing Step.
legendary_actions.desc: Mighty Yiga uses his Vanishing Step trait.

legendary_actions.name: Seismic Strike (Costs 2 Actions).
legendary_actions.desc: Mighty Yiga casts erupting earth without expending a spell slot or material components.

monsters.name: Monk Yiga
spells: Monk Yiga is a 17th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 19, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Monk Yiga can cast disguise self and invisibility at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: Monk Yiga has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
traits.desc: If Monk Yiga fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: Monk Yiga makes three attacks, with either his sword burst or temporal strike (if available).

actions.name: Sword Burst.
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 5 ft. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 5) force damage.

actions.name: Temporal Strike (Recharge 6).
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 52 (8d12) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it’s occupied.

monsters.legendary_description: Monk Yiga can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Sword Burst.
legendary_actions.desc: Monk Yiga makes a sword burst attack.

legendary_actions.name: Escape.
legendary_actions.desc: Monk Yiga teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet.

legendary_actions.name: Mirror (Costs 3 Actions).
legendary_actions.desc: Monk Yiga casts the mirror image spell at 2nd level without expending a spell slot or material components.

monsters.name: Malicious Djinn
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons
spells: (Innate). The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave

spells.3/day each: create food and water, tongues, wind walk

spells.1/day each: conjure elemental, creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift

traits.name: Elemental Demise.
traits.desc: If the djinn dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the malicious djinn was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The djinn makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

actions.name: Create Whirlwind.
actions.desc: A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinn can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinn maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinn that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. The djinn can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinn loses sight of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

monsters.name: Malicious Water Elemental
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

traits.name: Water Form.
traits.desc: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Freeze.
traits.desc: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whelm (Recharge 4-6).
actions.desc: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space. The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target grappled by it takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a DC 14 Strength check and succeeding.

monsters.name: Malicious Rock Moldorm
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone, poisoned
monsters.senses: tremorsense 20 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: he moldorm has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Evasive.
traits.desc: The moldorm can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Weak Point.
traits.desc: Attacks which specifically target the tip of the moldorm’s tail bypass its damage immunity. Any attack roll made as a called shot, such as against this weak point, is made with disadvantage.

traits.name: Wounded Fury.
traits.desc: While it has 20 hit points or fewer, the moldorm has advantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The moldorm makes one bite attack and one slam attack.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail Whip.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Malicious Emberhulk
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons

traits.name: Bleeding Fire.
traits.desc: While the emberhulk has 80 HP or less, flames begin leaking from its body and it's surrounded by an aura of flames. At the start of each of the emberhulk's turns, each creature within 5 ft of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the emberhulk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Illumination.
traits.desc: The emberhulk sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility.
traits.desc: For every 5 feet the emberhulk moves in water that is at least six feet deep, or for every 5 gallons of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage. This damage is not doubled by its vulnerability to cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The emberhulk makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10+7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: The emberhulk exhales fire in a 30-ft cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 28 (8d6) fire damage and is magically slowed for one minute. While slowed, the creature's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted. The slowed creature can make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the initial saving throw is successful, the target takes half the fire damage and is not slowed.

monsters.name: Malicious Lightning Golem
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Berserk.
traits.desc: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form.
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption.
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons.
traits.desc: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d10) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 (2d8 + 4) lightning damage.

monsters.name: Malicious Arrghost
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic, acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons

traits.name: Ghostly Veil.
traits.desc: The arrghost is invisible, except to beasts, who see a thin, pale blue outline. If the arrghost is exposed to direct light, or takes the Attack action on its turn while it is invisible, it becomes faintly visible until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Arrgi Swarm.
traits.desc: The arrghost psychically controls small creatures called arrgi, which surround and protect it. The arrghost starts with 10 arrgi, and any lost arrgi regenerate after a short rest. Arrgi can only be destroyed by an attack made against them. An attack which specifically targets an arrgi will instantly defeat it. Any attack roll made as a called shot, such as against an arrgi, is normally made with disadvantage.

traits.name: Aura of Destruction.
traits.desc: As long as the arrghost has at least 1 arrgi in its swarm, it can manipulate them to harm nearby enemies. A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the arrghost must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d4 bludgeoning damage for each arrgi in the swarm on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: If the arrghost has any arrgi in its swarm, it makes three arrgi attacks.

actions.name: Arrgi.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage. This attack can only be used if the arrghost has at least one arrgi in its swarm. The target creature can use their reaction to make an attack against an arrgi in the swarm without needing to make a called shot after the arrghost uses this attack.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d12 + 2) radiant damage.

actions.name: Recover Swarm (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: The arrghus adds up to 3 arrgi back to its swarm. The arrghus can not have more than 10 arrgi at a time.

reactions.name: Ghostly Jaunt.
reactions.desc: If the arrghost takes damage, it flies up to 30 feet in any direction without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: Malicious Spirit Naga
monsters.damage_resistances: poison, acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons
spells: The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep, thunderwave

traits.name: Rejuvenation.
traits.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Unnerving Mask.
reactions.desc: When a creature the naga can see starts its turn within 30 ft of the naga, the naga can create the illusion that it looks like one of the creature's departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the naga, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its turn.

monsters.name: Malicious Glacier Octo
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons

traits.name: Amphibious.
traits.desc: The octo can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Brute.
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the octo hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Charge.
traits.desc: If the octo moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Weak Point.
traits.desc: The big octo's damage resistance is ignored if the octo is unable to make reactions, or the attacker makes a called shot against the big octo's back side. A called shot normally imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Chilling Body.
traits.desc: A creature that touches the octo or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the octo takes 3 (1d6) cold damage. Any damage done by the octo deals an extra 3 (1d6) cold damage on a hit (included in the attack).

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) acid damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 15) and swallowed. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the octo, and it takes 13 (3d8) acid damage at the start of each of the octo's turns. The octo can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the octo dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Spit Rock.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d10 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb.
traits.desc: The skulltula can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Descent.
traits.desc: When climbing on a ceiling, the skulltula can spin rope-like webbing and use it to descend from the ceiling as part of using its climb speed. It can use its climb speed to ascend this rope-like webbing it creates as easily. This webbing otherwise has the same statistics as those in the Web action, below.

traits.name: Web Walker.
traits.desc: The skulltula ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monsters.name: Molduga
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Bad Landing.
traits.desc: If the molduga's jump is interrupted or disturbed by external factors, the molduga is stunned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Cetacean Leap.
traits.desc: The molduga's high jump distance is doubled.

traits.name: Tunneler.
traits.desc: The molduga can burrow through sand its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake that lasts for 1d4 minutes before collapsing.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

traits.name: Freedom of Movement.
traits.desc: The tektite can move across any nonmagical difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain.

traits.name: Pack Tactics.
traits.desc: The tektite has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the tektite's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Standing Leap.
traits.desc: The tektite's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Water Walker.
traits.desc: The tektite can walk, jump, or slide over the surface of water as easily as it can over land.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Armos
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), tremorsense 5 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility.
traits.desc: The armos is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armos must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Brute.
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the armos hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: False Appearance.
traits.desc: While the armos remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a stone statue.

traits.name: Inanimate Invulnerability.
traits.desc: If the armos did not move or take any actions on its last turn, or has not yet had a turn, it is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks; and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from magical attacks.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The armos knight makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage if used in one hand to make a melee attack, 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used in two hands to make a melee attack, or 7 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage if used to make a ranged attack.

monsters.name: Big Pengator
monsters.damage_resistances: cold

traits.name: Hold Breath.
traits.desc: The pengator can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

traits.name: Pack Tactics.
traits.desc: The pengator has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the pengator's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sliding Dash.
traits.desc: When on ice or other slippery terrain, the pengator can use its bonus action move up to its base walking speed in a straight line.

traits.name: Traction.
traits.desc: The pengator treats ice or other slippery difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

monsters.name: Baby Dodongo
monsters.damage_resistances: fire
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 10 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Death Burst.
traits.desc: When the dodongo dies, it explodes with a fiery, concussive burst. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) fire damage and 3 (1d6) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Big Poe
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.senses: blindsight 100 ft., tremorsense 5 ft., passive Perception 12

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: The poe has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight.
traits.desc: The poe can see 60 feet into the Silent Realm when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement.
traits.desc: The poe can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Lantern Attack.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage and if the target is a creature or flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Withering Slash.
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Rapid Spin.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 10 ft., all targets in range. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Etherealness.
actions.desc: The poe enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage.
actions.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the poe that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save failes by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4x10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Poe's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

monsters.name: Beamos
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: darkvision 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility.
traits.desc: The beamos is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the beamos must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Immutable Form.
traits.desc: The beamos is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Weak Point.
traits.desc: An attack which specifically targets the beamos's eye-gem bypasses its damage resistance. If the attack inflicts piercing damage, it not only bypasses immunity and resistance, but inflicts double damage. Any attack roll made as a called shot, such as against this weak point, is normally made with disadvantage.

actions.name: Eye Beam (Recharge 2-6).
actions.desc: The beamos produces a line of concentrated energy beam that is 120 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (11d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Cunning Action.
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the lizalfos can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage actions.

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: The lizalfos has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Standing Leap.
traits.desc: The lizalfos' long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Weak Point.
traits.desc: The horn of a lizalfos is bizarrely sensitive against disjointed strikes. If a called shot specifically targets this horn and hits, the lizalfos is involuntarily knocked prone on the spot. Normally, making a called shot imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Elemental Cloak.
traits.desc: The lizalfos is visibly and magically cloaked with an energy matching the damage type to which it is immune, based on its color.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The lizalfos makes three attacks.

If thrown into a wall or other solid surface, the thrown creature takes 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage from the impact. If thrown upward and allowed to fall, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it falls.

actions.name: Superbomb.
actions.desc: The Hinox throws a lit bomb anywhere within a range of 60 feet. Any creature within 5 feet of where the bomb lands must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) thunder damage. monsters.speed: 15 ft., fly 35 ft. (hover) (given by enchanted flight)
monsters.damage_resistances: slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage from non-magical weapons (given by enchanted flames)

traits.name: Necrotic Absorption.
traits.desc: Whenever the bubble is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead gains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

traits.name: Dark Cloak.
traits.desc: The bubble’s body is burning with magical darkness, which out to a range of 5 feet makes dim light dark, and makes bright light dim light. Any creature which directly touches it takes 14 (4d6) necrotic damage, and is incapacitated for 1 minute. At the end of each of the incapacitated creature's turns, it can make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw to end the effect early. After a creature takes damage from touching the bubble or the bubble takes radiant damage, the bubble's darkness goes out until the end of its next turn or if it is subjected to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Enchanted Flames.
traits.desc: While the bubble's dark cloak is active, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It also receives a flying speed (hover) of 35 feet. If the flame goes out while it is suspended in the air, it falls to the ground.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: The bubble has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bash.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is exposed to the bubble’s dark cloak if it is active.

monsters.damage_immunities: damage type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one
monsters.senses: Darkvision 60 ft., Tremorsense 10 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Amorphous.
traits.desc: The chuchu can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Elemental Cloak.
traits.desc: The chuchu is visibly and magically cloaked with an energy matching the damage type to which it is immune, based on its color.

traits.name: Shocking Cloak.
traits.desc: The chuchu only has this trait if has an elemental cloak of lightning. Any creature which touches it directly or with an electricity-conducting weapon (including most metal weapons) takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. If the creature takes this damage, it must also succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or drop everything it is holding and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d12 + 1) bludgeoning damage, plus an extra 7 (2d6) damage of type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature at least one size category smaller than the chuchu. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 14), and restrained for the duration of the grapple. While the target is grappled, at the beginning of each of the chuchu's turn the target takes 9 (2d8) acid damage plus an extra 5 (1d10) of a damage type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one. While the target is grappled, the chuchu cannot swallow another target.

actions.name: Withdraw.
actions.desc: The chuchu reduces itself to a formless puddle on the ground, and remains as such until the start of its next turn. While withdrawn, the chuchu is incapacitated; it has immunity to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage; and it has resistance to magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

reactions.name: Burst.
reactions.desc: The chuchu can only use this reaction if it has an elemental cloak. When reduced to 0 HP, a burst of magical energy gushes from the chuchu in all directions. Every creature within 15 feet of the chuchu must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 11 (2d10) damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage type matches that of the chuchu's elemental cloak.

traits.name: Martial Advantage.
traits.desc: Once per turn, the bokoblin can deal an extra 10 (3d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the bokoblin that isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The bokoblin makes two attacks with its club.

actions.name: Club.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the bokoblin can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the bokoblin. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the bokoblin is incapacitated.

reactions.name: Redirect Attack.
reactions.desc: When a creature the bokoblin can see targets it with an attack, the bokoblin chooses another bokoblin within 5 feet of it. The two bokoblins swap places, and the chosen bokoblin becomes the target instead.

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: The poe has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight.
traits.desc: The poe can see 60 feet into the Silent Realm when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement.
traits.desc: The poe can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Lantern Attack.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage and if the target is a creature or flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Withering Slash.
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Rapid Spin.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 10 ft., all targets in range. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Fireball.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 50/100 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 +6) fire damage and if the target is a creature or flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Etherealness.
actions.desc: The poe enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage.
actions.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the poe that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save failes by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4x10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Poe's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6).
actions.desc: One humanoid that the poe can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the poe; the poe then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The poe now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The poe can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 00 hit points, the Poe ends it as a bonus action, or the poe is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the Poe reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this poe's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

monsters.name: Hardhat Beetle
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Charge.
traits.desc: If the beetle moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Pushover.
traits.desc: The hardhat beetle has disadvantage on ability checks to avoid being shoved.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Bubble
monsters.speed: 15 ft., fly 35 ft. (hover) (given by enchanted flight)

traits.name: Enchanted Flight.
traits.desc: The bubble gains a flight speed (hover) of 35 feet. If the bubble takes damage, it loses this flight speed and falls to the ground until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: False Appearance.
traits.desc: While motionless, the bubble is indistinguishable from a very large skull.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: The bubble has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bash.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Cunning Action.
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the lizalfos can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage actions.

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: The lizalfos has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Standing Leap.
traits.desc: The lizalfos' long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Weak Point.
traits.desc: The horn of a lizalfos is bizarrely sensitive against disjointed strikes. If a called shot specifically targets this horn and hits, the lizalfos is involuntarily knocked prone on the spot. Normally, making a called shot imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The lizalfos makes two attacks.

actions.name: Tongue Snap (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used in two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Spit.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +2 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (2d4) acid damage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The captain makes three melee attacks.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

reactions.name: Parry.

monsters.name: Keese
monsters.damage_immunities: damage type matching the chuchu's elemental cloak if it has one

traits.name: Elemental Cloak.
traits.desc: The chuchu is visibly and magically cloaked with an energy matching the damage type to which it is immune, based on its color.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the keese has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus an extra 3 (1d6) of a damage type matching the keese’s elemental cloak if it has one.

monsters.name: Pengator
monsters.damage_resistances: cold

traits.name: Hold Breath.
traits.desc: The pengator can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

traits.name: Pack Tactics.
traits.desc: The pengator has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the pengator's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sliding Dash.
traits.desc: When on ice or other slippery terrain, the pengator can use its bonus action move up to its base walking speed in a straight line.

traits.name: Traction.
traits.desc: The pengator treats ice or other slippery difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

traits.name: Amphibious.
traits.desc: The octorok can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Sun Sickness.
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the pikit has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The pikit dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Tongue.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the pikit, and restrained until the grapple ends. The pikit can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

traits.name: Pack Tactics.
traits.desc: The bokoblin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bokoblin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Red Bubble
monsters.speed: 15 ft., fly 35 ft. (hover) (given by enchanted flight)
monsters.damage_resistances: slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage from non-magical weapons (given by enchanted flames)

traits.name: Fire Absorption.
traits.desc: Whenever the bubble is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead gains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Fire Cloak.
traits.desc: The bubble's body is burning with magical fire, which sheds light as a torch. Any creature which physically touches it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage. and takes another 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of its turns unless it uses its action to extinguish the flames. After a creature takes damage from touching the bubble or the bubble takes cold damage, the bubble's fire goes out until the end of its next turn or if it is subjected to fire damage.

traits.name: Enchanted Flames.
traits.desc: While the bubble's fire cloak is active, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It also receives a flying speed (hover) of 35 feet. If the flame goes out while it is suspended in the air, it falls to the ground.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: The bubble has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bash.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is exposed to the bubble’s fire cloak if it is active.

monsters.name: Redead
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic
monsters.damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical ranged attacks
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Brute.
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the redead hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Grappler.
traits.desc: The redead has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the redead can't bite another target.

actions.name: Paralyzing Shriek (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: A horrifying shriek echoes from the redead's face. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. The redead can designate one target within range it can see to have disadvantage on this initial saving throw. On a failed save, a target is frightened and paralyzed for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Redead's Reach.
bonus_actions.desc: The redead moves up to its speed straight toward a creature frightened of it that it can see, and makes a bite attack against it if it is within reach.

traits.name: Brute.
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Hinox hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Punch.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Throw.
actions.desc: The Hinox throws a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling a distance of up to 60 feet, or a height of up to 40 feet. If thrown into a wall or other solid surface, the thrown creature takes 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage from the impact. If thrown upward and allowed to fall, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it falls.

traits.name: Martial Advantage.
traits.desc: Once per turn, the moblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the moblin that isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage. Two handed: 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics.
traits.desc: The bokoblin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bokoblin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Nimble Escape.
traits.desc: The bokoblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The bokoblin makes two attacks with its shortsword or shortbow.

actions.name: Shortsword.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow.

traits.name: Martial Advantage.
traits.desc: Once per turn, the moblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the moblin that isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
traits.desc: For 1 minute, the moblin can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the moblin. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the moblin is incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The moblin makes two one-handed melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage. Two handed: 10 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Club.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Small Poe
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, cold, lightning
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 5 ft., passive Perception 11

traits.name: Ambusher.
traits.desc: The poe has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight.
traits.desc: The poe can see 60 feet into the Silent Realm when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement.
traits.desc: The poe can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Lantern Attack.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d6) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage and if the target is a creature or flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Ghastly Touch.
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Magic Drain.
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 necrotic damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). While the target is grappled, the poe cannot use Magic Drain on another target. The target loses 1 magic point, or 2 on a critical hit. If the target has no magic points, it loses an equal number of stamina points if it has any. For each point lost, the poe recovers 4 (1d8) hit points.

traits.name: Shadow Camouflage.
traits.desc: The wallmaster has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness.

traits.name: Spider Climb.
traits.desc: The wallmaster can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage, and a Large or smaller target is grappled (escape DC 15). While the target is grappled, the wallmaster cannot attack another target.

actions.name: Drop.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, one creature directly underneath the wallmaster. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen, up to 21 (6d6). If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15). While the target is grappled, the wallmaster cannot attack another target.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, one creature grappled by the wallmaster that is not grappled by another creature. Hit: The target is safely teleported, as the spell, to the entrance of the structure or cave in which the target currently resides. If the target is not in a structure or cave of any sort, or the teleporation otherwise fails, the target instead suffers 7 (2d6) force damage.

actions.name: Vertical Flight.
actions.desc: The wallmaster gains a magical flight speed of 60 feet until the start of its next turn, which it can only use to travel straight up or straight down. It cannot attack while flying.

monsters.name: White Bubble
monsters.speed: 15 ft., fly 35 ft. (hover) (given by enchanted flight)
monsters.damage_resistances: slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage from non-magical weapons (given by enchanted flames)

traits.name: Cold Absorption.
traits.desc: Whenever the bubble is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead gains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

traits.name: Cold Cloak.
traits.desc: The bubble's body is frigid with magical ice. Any creature which physically touches it takes 7 (2d6) cold damage. and takes another 3 (1d6) cold damage at the end of each of its turns unless it uses its action to warm up. After a creature takes damage from touching the bubble or the bubble takes fire damage, the bubble's cloak goes out until the end of its next turn or if it is subjected to cold damage.

traits.name: Enchanted Flames.
traits.desc: While the bubble's cold cloak is active, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It also receives a flying speed (hover) of 35 feet. If the flame goes out while it is suspended in the air, it falls to the ground.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.desc: The bubble has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bash.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is exposed to the bubble’s cold cloak if it is active.

monsters.name: Wizzrobe
monsters.damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks; damage type matching the wizzrobe's elemental cloak

traits.name: Elemental Cloak.
traits.desc: The wizzrobe is visibly and magically cloaked with an energy matching the damage type to which it is immune, based on its color.

traits.name: Sneak Attack.
traits.desc: Once per turn, if no targets know the location of the wizzrobe, it deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a spell attack and has advantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Dark Ball.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Hurl Elemental Energy.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 150 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) damage of a type equivalent to the wizzrobe's elemental cloak.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.desc: The wizzrobe may disappear and reappear in any space that it can see up to 200 ft. away. When the Wizzrobe re-appears, all creatures in combat must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom (Perception) save or lose track of the Wizzrobe. They may repeat this save each round in order to locate the wizzrobe, but will be alerted to its location if it attacks them from its new location.

monsters.name: Zola Chief
monsters.damage_resistances: Fire

traits.name: Amphibious.
traits.desc: The zola can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
traits.desc: For 1 minute, the zola can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the zola. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. The effect ends if the zola is incapacitated.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage.
traits.desc: The zola has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The zola makes three attacks, and can substitute its fire bolt for any of these attacks.

actions.name: Longsword.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used in two hands.

actions.name: Fire Bolt.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: The zola exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Parry.
reactions.desc: The zola adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the zola must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Zola
monsters.damage_resistances: Fire

traits.name: Ambush (1/Turn).
traits.desc: The zola deals an extra 2 (1d4) damage to one target it hits with a ranged attack if it had advantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Amphibious.
traits.desc: The zola can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage.
traits.desc: The zola has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The zola makes two attacks, and can substitute its fire bolt for any of these attacks.

actions.name: Dagger.
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Bolt.
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

monsters.name: Wolfos
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
traits.desc: The wolfos has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Reckless Multiattack.
actions.desc: The wolfos makes one claw attacks and one bite attack. If none of these attacks hit, the wolfos is incapacitated until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Howl.
actions.desc: Each non-Wolfos creature within 200 feet of the Wolfos must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute.

traits.name: Death Burst.
traits.desc: When the dodongo dies, it explodes with a fiery, concussive burst. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) fire damage and 3 (1d6) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Swift Tail Spin.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., all targets in range. Hit: 5 (2d6 - 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.desc: The Dodongo exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 25 (5d8 + 2) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

nested.callback: return `Kill one _${monster.name}_ for every ${monster.hp} damage dealt to the mob`

nested.diceCallback: return [{ text: ( parseInt(monster["party-level"]) * parseInt(monster["hit_dice_num"]) ) + monster["hit_dice_val"] + ' + ' + ( ( ( parseInt(monster.stats[2])-10) / 2 ) * parseInt(monster["party-level"]) * parseInt(monster["hit_dice_num"]) ) }]
